wikipedia_page.main:
Frederick James Marquis, 1st Earl of Woolton,  (23 August 1883 – 14 December 1964) was an English businessman and statesman.
In April 1940, he was appointed Minister of Food, and established the rationing system, generally regarded as a success. He maintained food imports from America, kept prices down and organised a programme of free school meals. With a shortage of meat, fish and dairy products, his recommended dish was the vegetarian Woolton pie, for which he would always be remembered.
In 1943, Woolton was appointed Minister of Reconstruction, planning for post-war Britain, and became Conservative Party chairman from 1946 to 1955. He was given credit for the Conservative victory in 1951.
